FuncDef:
The ds-lite centralized-backup switch down-number command sets the maximum number of failed CPUs in centralized DS-Lite providing backup for centralized DS-Lite.
The undo ds-lite centralized-backup switch down-number command restores the default maximum number of failed CPUs in centralized DS-Lite providing backup for centralized DS-Lite.
The default maximum number of failed CPUs in centralized DS-Lite providing backup for centralized DS-Lite is 1.

ParaDef.Info:
Sets the maximum number of failed CPUs allowed in centralized DS-Lite providing backup for centralized DS-Lite.
The value is an integer ranging from 1 to 16.

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
In centralized DS-Lite providing backup for centralized DS-Lite, if the centralized-boards on the primary DS-Lite device fails and users are online, user traffic switches to the backup DS-Lite device for DS-Lite processing.
If a specified maximum number of CPUs fail on the primary DS-Lite device, traffic switches to the backup DS-Lite device. To set this maximum number, run the
ds-lite centralized-backup switch down-number command. The implementation is as follows:
If the number of failed CPUs of centralized-boards on the master DS-Lite is greater than or equal to , traffic switches to the backup DS-Lite device.If is greater than the total number of CPUs of centralized-boards on the master DS-Lite and all CPUs fail, traffic also switches to the backup DS-Lite device.

Prerequisites
Centralized DS-Lite providing backup for centralized DS-Lite has been enabled using the ds-lite centralized-backup enable command.
Precautions
The ds-lite centralized-backup enable command takes effect only on the VSUF-80/VSUF-160/VSUI-160-E/VSUI-400/VSUI-400-E/VSUI-400A/VSUI-400A-E/VSUI-400-S/VSUI-400A-S.
